data.title: About the Journal
data.text:
Publisher: PAKISTAN ATOMIC ENERGY COMMISSION (PAEC)

Focus and Scope: The Nucleus is an open-access international, multidisciplinary peer-reviewed biannual scientific journal. It offers a platform for scientists and engineers to publish their original and current research of high scientific value in all areas of natural and applied sciences at the international level.

Peer Review Process: Outline the journal's peer review policy and processes for readers and authors, including the number of reviewers typically used in reviewing a submission, the criteria by which reviewers are asked to judge submissions, typical time taken to conduct the reviews, and the principles for recruiting reviewers. This will appear in About the Journal. The Nucleus follows the double-blind peer-reviewed process.

Publication Frequency: The Nucleus is an open-access journal published twice a year. The journal is being published electronically as well as in hard form.

Charges and Fees: Publication is free of charge in The Nucleus. The authors must pay no fee at any stage (submission, review, printing, etc.) of the manuscript processing.

Journal History: The Nucleus is published regularly since 1964

Aims and Scope: The Nucleus is an international, multidisciplinary peer-reviewed open-access scientific journal. It offers a platform for scientists and engineers to publish their original and current research of high scientific value in all areas of natural and applied sciences at the international level.
